intro: Hieracium phaecasiifolium, commonly known as the black-leaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, surrounded by bracts. Its leaves are broad and often have a distinctive dark green color with a waxy coating. Hieracium phaecasiifolium is often found in meadows and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
